Minecraft is a great game that allows players to use their creativity and imagination. It is an open-world sandbox game where you can build anything you want using blocksâ€”houses, castles, machines, and even cities. Players can explore different biomes, mine resources, craft tools, and fight monsters. Minecraft also teaches problem-solving, planning, and teamwork, especially in multiplayer mode. With different game modes like Survival, Creative, and Adventure, it is fun for all age groups.

Minecraft Pocket Edition urgently needs an "Export World" or "Backup" option. Players spend months building worlds, and if the app is deleted or the device changes, everything can be lost forever. Please for the love of God let us disable autosave, or at the very least change the intervals of it. I didn't realise this, but if your world gets to a certain size the frequency of autosaves increases significantly. Autosaves completely lag out the game, causing the player to ping back to previous positions, entities to freeze, and items from broken blocks to float in mid-air (likely more too). It has gotten to the point that a world I've grown to love dearly is now pretty much unplayable :(
